description: When a request is made to Keystone, information such as user_id, project_id, among others, are setted in the class NovaKeystoneContext https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/auth.py#L79. When using the Keystone V3 API, domain information should be passed, but Nova is not ready to receive this information.
title: Information about domain are not setted in the Nova context

comments.content: When a request is made to Keystone, information such as user_id, project_id, among others, are setted in the class NovaKeystoneContext https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/auth.py#L79. When using the Keystone V3 API, domain information should be passed, but Nova is not ready to receive this information.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~raildo

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master

Author: Davanum Srinivas <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Nov 11 20:19:32 2013 -0500

    Adding domain to context and log
    
    Add support for upcoming "domain" concept in Keystone V3 API in
    both logging and context.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1248936
    Implements: blueprint add-domain-info-to-context
